recommendations.recommendation: A hilarious sendup of Dragon Quest, and 1980s - mid 1990s JRPGS in general. This is either going to be love it or hate it, with frenetic pacing and oddball jokes flying every whichway. Don`t be afraid to keep going, as the first episode is close to the worst one.

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch102013 [Nike], a boy from the http://anidb.net/ch102052 [Boering Village], is forcefully sent along on a quest to defeat the Devil King after his Hero-worshipping parents see a posting from the king summoning potential heroes. Following the village`s traditions, he visits the http://anidb.net/ch102030 [magical old lady] where he is entrusted with caring for a young girl named http://anidb.net/ch102014 [Kukuri], who can use the mysterious Guru Guru magic. According to the old woman`s claims, Kukuri is the last survivor of the Migu Migu clan who wield Guru Guru, and she has been waiting for a Hero to appear. It will be a journey filled with laughter, and occasional tears. And now the classic fantasy featuring a slacker Hero and a naive young Mage begins unfold! Source: crunchyroll Note: The first two episodes get an advance airing on June 17, 2017. Regular TV airing started in July 2017.

externalentity.identifier: 魔法陣グルグル_(2017年のアニメ)

tag.name: fairy
tag.description: A fairy is a type of mythical being or legendary creature in European folklore, a form of spirit, often described as metaphysical, supernatural, or preternatural. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: summoning
tag.description: Ability to call/materialize some kind of creature.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: absurdist humour
tag.description: Surreal humour, also known as absurdist humour, is a form of humour predicated on deliberate violations of causal reasoning, producing events and behaviours that are obviously illogical. Constructions of surreal humour tend to involve bizarre juxtapositions, non-sequiturs, irrational or absurd situations, and expressions of nonsense. The humour arises from a subversion of audience`s expectations, so that amusement is founded on unpredictability, separate from a logical analysis of the situation. Its appeal stems from the fact that the situation described is exceedingly ridiculous or unlikely. On an analytical level, all jokes contain a certain amount of incongruity, but while regular jokes carry an incongruity that the audience accepts as compatible with expectations, absurd jokes are characterized by a disproportionate amount of it, with the punch line delivering a situation incompatible with the world as we know it and failing to resolve the matter in the audience`s eyes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: magic circles
tag.description: A magic circle is circle or sphere of space marked out by practitioners of many branches of ritual magic. It may be marked physically, drawn in salt or chalk, for example, or merely visualised. Traditionally, circles have been used by ritual magicians to form a protective barrier between themselves and what they summoned. Nowadays, circles often have the more benign function of containing and concentrating the energy raised during a ritual. Circles can also be used as barriers for non-magical work such as meditation. Generally, as with most magical practices, an incantation is recited stating the purpose and nature of the circle, often repeating an assortment of divine and angelic names. Source: wiki

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: funny expressions
tag.description: The facial expressions of the characters may change so quickly or unexpectedly distort that hilarity will ensue.

tag.name: first love
tag.description: Ah… first love. The love that is remembered the most fondly by the participant, as this is commonly what people experience when they first have a first crush, but it is also the love before the Second Love, if that should ever happen, and for a guy, he usually holds her memory very close to him if he is a widower whereas for young girls, the memory of the First Love they ever had is a special memory to them, especially if he later becomes the boyfriend they`ve longed for. Source: TVTrope

tag.name: facial distortion
tag.description: The characters face are exaggerated into a misshape, deformed, and almost warped. Used as comedy element to express extreme mood swings. Differing from "http://anidb.net/t2652 [Super Deformed]", here only the face changes to an extreme degree, not the whole body of the protagonist.

tag.name: love at first sight
tag.description: Plot device: When two characters meet for the first time, at least one party, supposedly, immediately falls in love with the other party, and from then on tries to get to know that party better.

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: randomness
tag.description: The anime does not follow a predictable storyline. New, strange, obscure, or otherwise unexpected story elements are introduced at a whim.

tag.name: magic weapons
tag.description: The characters in this anime wield magic weapons.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Alahabica
character.description: The whole city of Alahabica was merely an illusion that protected the Ruins of Panfos. After the inhabitants had retreaded and third key had been activated, the buildings rearranged and ruins were revealed.

episode.title: おでかけ! 修行ハウス!
Off to the Training House!
외출! 수행하우스!
Odekake! Shugyou House!
episode.summary: Nike and Kukuri meet with a mysterious society, and that meeting sends them on a quest to gain the strength to beat the Demon King. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対決! ノコギリ山!
Battle! On Saw Mountain!
대결! 톱산!
Taiketsu! Nokogiri Yama!
episode.summary: What are the secrets of Guru Guru? Even Kukuri, the last known inheritor of the magic techniques, doesn`t know for sure. It`s just then when a mysterious woman appears who may have some answers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 踊れ! キタの町!
Dance! North Town!
춤춰라! 북의 마을!
Odore! Kita no Machi!
episode.summary: The northern town of North is plagued by misfortune now that monsters have moved into nearby Saw Mountain. Our heroes are unsure about whether they can help liberate the town, but when a monster kidnaps Kukuri and a local girl, Nike doesn`t have much of a choice but to take action. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 旅立ち! ジミナ村!
Departure! Boering Village!
여행 출발! 따분한마을!
Tabidachi! Jimina Mura!
episode.summary: Long ago, the Demon King was sealed away thanks to the special magic known as Guru Guru. 300 years later, he has returned, and humanity is waiting for a hero who will rise up to oppose him. Unfortunately for them, all they`ll get instead are the lazy Nike and the naive Kukuri, who set out on an adventure to save the world. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔法陣グルグル 放送スタート直前スペシャル!! ドミノで魔法陣! 完成するまで帰れません!
Episode S1
Mahoujin Guru Guru: Housou Start Chokuzen Special!! Domino de Mahoujin! Kansei Suru made Kaeremasen!
再会! ネコジタ谷!
Reunion! Cattongue Valley!
재회! 고양이혀계곡!
Saikai! Nekojita Tani!
episode.summary: Nike and Kukuri are reunited with an old friend, and head to Cattongue Valley in pursuit of the daemon, Siren. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 発見! 妖精の村!
Discovery! The Fairy Forest!
발견! 요정마을!
Hakken! Yousei no Mura!
episode.summary: The quest continues as Nike and Kukuri arrive in a fairy village, where the elder offers to share new Guru Guru secrets in exchange for the defeat of a nearby monster. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ライバル登場! アッチ村!
A Rival Appears! Yondor Village!
라이벌 등장! 저쪽마을!
Rival Toujou! Acchi Mura!
episode.summary: With their training complete, Nike and Kukuri continue their journey only to run into a fearsome new rival. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 救え! シュギ村!
Rescue! Dohgma Village!
구하라! 주의마을!
Sukue! Shugi Mura!
episode.summary: While Kukuri`s Guru Guru training proceeds, Nike has to team up with the priestess Juju to save the village of Dohgma. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦え! コパール城!
Fight! Copahl Castle!
싸워라! 코팔성
Tatakae! Copahl-jou!
episode.summary: Joined by Runrun, Juju, and Sly the thief, our heroes enter Copahl Castle in an attempt to rescue its princess and retrieve the Banana Moon, a powerful magic relic. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 弟子入り! コパの森!
Apprenticeship! Copa`s Forest!
제자입문! 코파의 숲
Deshiiri! Kopa no Mori!
episode.summary: Captured by a group of thieves in the kingdom of Copahl, Kukuri and her hero get wrapped up in a plot involving an evil chancellor and a magic artifact. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 攻略! きりなしの塔!
Clearing the Endless Tower!
공략! 끝없는탑!
Kouryaku! Kirinashi no Tou!
episode.summary: At the top of Endless Tower, Nike, Kukuri, and Toma confront one of the Demon King`s enforcers in a battle to reach Siren. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 神秘! ミグミグ族の遺跡!
Mystery! Ruins of the Migu Migu Clan!
신비! 미그미그족의 유적!
Shinpi! Migumigu Zoku no Iseki!
episode.summary: Kukuri and her party arrive in mysterious ruins with a mysterious connection to her past, and before heading to Endless Tower. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 守れ! パンフォスの遺跡!
Defense! The Panfos Ruins!
지켜라! 판포스의 유적
Mamore! Panfos no Iseki!
episode.summary: The hidden ruins of Panfos have appeared, but the Demon King`s army is planning an assault. Can Nike and his friends defend the tower and find Kukuri, who has gone missing inside of it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋せよ! 魔境!
Love! In the Uncanny Lands!
사랑하라! 마경!
Koi Seyo! Makyou!
episode.summary: With Kukuri having been turned into a demon it`s up to Nike and Toma to find a way to turn her back to normal, while also tracking down the location of the daemon hidden near Alahabica. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 摩訶不思議! アラハビカ!
Enigmatic! Alahabica!
매우이상한! 아라하비카!
Makafushigi! Alahabica!
episode.summary: Nike and Kukuri find a hint that might lead them to the next daemon, but Giri`s forces are intent on sabotaging their relationship before that happens. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説! イエタ村!
Legends! Tellum Village!
전설! 말했다마을!
Densetsu! Ieta Mura!
episode.summary: Having saved the kingdom of Copahl, Nike and Kukuri find themselves headed towards a strange land inhabited by monsters. But are they friend or foe? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 抜け出せ! レフ島!
Escape! Lef Island!
탈출하라! 레프섬!
Nukedase! Lef Shima!
episode.summary: Nike and Kukuri have been on Lef Island for a while now, and while their time there is pleasant, they find themselves having a hard time moving on. Are they just enjoying the island`s leisurely place, or is there something stranger going on? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 歌え! バトーハの塔!
Sing! The Tower of Batoha!
노래하라! 바토하의 탑
Utae! Batoha no Tou!
episode.summary: With Kukuri kidnapped by Raid and the Queen of Flowers under assault, can Nike rescue his traveling companion and protect their surrogate daughter? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 咲け! 花の国!
Bloom! The Land of Flowers!
피워라! 꽃의 왕국!
Sake! Hana no Kuni!
episode.summary: On their way to the Land of Flowers, Nike and Kukuri arrive at Ettle Village, a town known for it`s chocolate. After finding out that monsters are keeping the confectionery business shut down, they head into the woods in pursuit of satisfying Kukuri`s sweet tooth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鳴らせ! エルエル村!
Beat It! Erueru Village!
울려라! 에루에루마을!
Narase! Erueru Mura!
episode.summary: Nike and Kukuri tread through a scorching desert and make their way to Erueru village, where they learn of a ritual that may help the hero unlock his next level of magic. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: グルグルぷちあにめ劇場 ぼうけんのしょ その20
Guru Guru Petit Anime Theater: Book of Adventure - Part 20
Guru Guru Petit Anime Gekijou: Bouken no Sho - Sono 20

Guru Guru Petit Anime Gekijou: Bouken no Sho - Sono 3
グルグルぷちあにめ劇場 ぼうけんのしょ その2
Guru Guru Petit Anime Theater: Book of Adventure - Part 2
Guru Guru Petit Anime Gekijou: Bouken no Sho - Sono 2
グルグルぷちあにめ劇場 ぼうけんのしょ その1
Guru Guru Petit Anime Theater: Book of Adventure - Part 1
Guru Guru Petit Anime Gekijou: Bouken no Sho - Sono 1
発動! 恋するハート!
Engaged! A Heart in Love!
발동! 사랑하는 하트!
Hatsudou! Koi Suru Heart!
episode.summary: It`s all come down to this moment... the hero Nike must defend companion, the Guru Guru user Kukuri, as she attempts to seal away Demon King Giri. With the fate of the world in the balance, can they overcome the overwhelming dark powers of an entity that threatens to overwrite all of reality? And even if they do win, what will become of them? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! ギリの城!
Battle! Giri`s Castle!
결전! 기리의 성!
Kessen! Giri no Shiro!
episode.summary: After all their struggles, Nike, Kukuri, and their friends have arrived in the Demon King`s territory: the continent of Zan. But before they can confront the master of evil, old rivals will stand in their way. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 潜入! ジタリの遺跡!
Sneaking In! The Jitari Ruins!
잠입! 지타리의 유적
Sennyuu! Jitari no Iseki!
episode.summary: An ancient secret rests within the Jitari Ruins, and the Demon King`s forces have kidnapped Juju to unleash it. WIll Nike, Kukuri, and Toma arrive in time to save their friend? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活! 魔王ギリ!
Revived! Demon King Giri!
부활! 마왕 기리!
Fukkatsu! Maou Giri!
episode.summary: While Nike and Kukuri were trapped on Lef Island, the Demon King was revived! With the demonic threat looming larger than ever, they hurry to the Jitari Ruins to obtain the next tool in their quest. Source: crunchyroll
